title: What with Mrs Eaves?
content:
Hallo,   
I have to make some display signs and map ('you are here' kind) layouts for a school, and I'd like to use Mrs Eaves (white on black) for main titles, plus something else (grey on white) for details. What do you suggest? Something not eye-catching and sans-serif yet sleek.   
   
thank you very much

 [‹ Production Company Logo Design](http://web.archive.org/web/20071208063431/http:/typophile.com/node/6738 "Go to previous forum topic") [Number of fonts to use ... ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071208063431/http:/typophile.com/node/6623 "Go to next forum topic")
author: manard

comments.content:
So I'm confused do you want a sans or not? (the wording was a bit ambiguous)   
   
If you do want a sans, i'd recommend Storm's [John Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20071208063431/http:/www.stormtype.com/jsans.html) as both [Mrs. Eaves](http://web.archive.org/web/20071208063431/http:/emigre.com/EF.php?fid=109) and John Sans are based on the Baskerville face.
Mrs Eaves is not something I would suggest for 'way finding' signage.

LOL, at BYU they used Mrs. Eaves for everything )(I think it musta been some type of "official" university face or sumfin). I don't see why you should discount signage!   
But seriously I agree with Kyle. A good, sturdy sans seems a more likely candidate for this type of thing than Mrs. Eaves.
paul. actually byu's official typeface is ... i believe ... hoefler text. the design department however does tend to use mrs. eaves a lot. or they did when i was teaching there.
:^D i was only joking, miss tiff. i just made that remark because mrs. eaves is overused on that campus.

I agree that Mrs Eaves shouldn't be used for "way finding"; but he said the signage was for "you are here", not "this way".   
   
If the wording of your final sentence, Massimo, meant that you wanted a sans-serif, I am enamoured with Slimbach's Myriad (Bold or Semibold may be appropriate); but I am unsure how well a fit that makes with Mrs Eaves.
BYU = Brigham Young University, my alma mater

Yes, Micah, that's exactly what I was thinking about. I thougt of Helvetica neue compressed also, or Metron from Storm. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20071208063431im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
i'm in love with storm recently. someday when i'm rich im gonna buy their whole library. i'd definately choose metron over helvetica.

Metron is great, but I think Dyna Grotesk is better. I think it would work very well with Mrs. Eaves. John Sans is a great suggestion tho. Preface from Nick (Shinntype) could be more interesting tho, a little unexpected.
